data.text: @well_tweet @GraemeGun I would have said the same to anyone, no matter their agenda. Project your angst on someone else please.
@dmac_dam @GraemeGun Don’t pretend to be impartial after your “draw what ever conclusions your narrative requires” comment.
@well_tweet @GraemeGun I'm not saying anything. I'm just stating the fact his data and your data are different. Before you draw comparisons between the two.

@stephen_streat @GraemeGun Yes, with the caveat that the numbers are quite small. Here’s data on the risk of death in Queensland (where they’ve had a significant number of aged care deaths) https://t.co/BcCmrZyNbg

@jd_ange @EvidenceTroll @GraemeGun This data is for the 18+ population. Very few children are hospitalized, and in NZ they have not all had an opportunity to get two doses of vaccine, and don’t qualify for a third dose. Of course it’s accurate for the 18+ age group... and is consistent with the Australian data
@jd_ange @GraemeGun NZ was 44.4% with a vaccine booster on February 22, so the data is from within the last week. The only thing misleading is your comment... the data are fine!
@Ganeshan @GraemeGun Nope. The MoH figures exclude under 12s (at the moment).

@dmac_dam @GraemeGun And you can accuse me of doing what the OP actually did when all I did was correct his data. Or are you saying that leaving the pre-vax data in paints a more accurate picture of vaccination?
@well_tweet @GraemeGun Per capita? 95% of us are vaxed.
@well_tweet @GraemeGun You can draw what ever conclusions your narrative requires, I was just stating the differences in your data sets.
